comment:
* Base class for functions that accept one argument.
 * @xsl.usage advanced

variables.name: m_arg0
variables.comment:
The first argument passed to the function (at index 0).
   *  @serial

methods.name: public Expression getArg0()
methods.comment:
* Return the first argument passed to the function (at index 0).
   *
   * @return An expression that represents the first argument passed to the 
   *         function.

methods.name: public void setArg(Expression arg, int argNum) throws WrongNumberArgsException
methods.comment:
* Set an argument expression for a function.  This method is called by the 
   * XPath compiler.
   *
   * @param arg non-null expression that represents the argument.
   * @param argNum The argument number index.
   *
   * @throws WrongNumberArgsException If the argNum parameter is greater than 0.

methods.name: public void checkNumberArgs(int argNum) throws WrongNumberArgsException
methods.comment:
* Check that the number of arguments passed to this function is correct. 
   *
   *
   * @param argNum The number of arguments that is being passed to the function.
   *
   * @throws WrongNumberArgsException

methods.name: protected void reportWrongNumberArgs() throws WrongNumberArgsException
methods.comment:
* Constructs and throws a WrongNumberArgException with the appropriate
   * message for this function object.
   *
   * @throws WrongNumberArgsException

methods.name: public boolean canTraverseOutsideSubtree()
methods.comment:
* Tell if this expression or it's subexpressions can traverse outside 
   * the current subtree.
   * 
   * @return true if traversal outside the context node's subtree can occur.

methods.name: public void fixupVariables(java.util.Vector vars, int globalsSize)
methods.comment:
* This function is used to fixup variables from QNames to stack frame 
   * indexes at stylesheet build time.
   * @param vars List of QNames that correspond to variables.  This list 
   * should be searched backwards for the first qualified name that 
   * corresponds to the variable reference qname.  The position of the 
   * QName in the vector from the start of the vector will be its position 
   * in the stack frame (but variables above the globalsTop value will need 
   * to be offset to the current stack frame).

methodNames: public void setArg(Expression arg, int argNum) throws WrongNumberArgsException
public void checkNumberArgs(int argNum) throws WrongNumberArgsException
public void fixupVariables(java.util.Vector vars, int globalsSize)
